Package net.xqhs.flash.core.composite

Class CompositeAgentLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.flash.core.composite.CompositeAgentLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Loader<Agent>
    public class CompositeAgentLoader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Loader<Agent>
    Agent loader for agents extending CompositeAgent.

    The choice of using a specialized loader as opposed to using the default loader and doing all the loading inside the composite agent was made so as to decouple dynamic class loading, as well as calls to ClassFactory.loadClassInstance(java.lang.String, net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, boolean) from the actual implementation of CompositeAgent.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

      • SHARD_CLASS_PARAMETER

        private static final java.lang.String SHARD_CLASS_PARAMETER
        The name of the attribute representing the class of the shard in the shard node. The class may not be specified, it the shard is standard and its class is specified by the corresponding AgentShardDesignation.StandardAgentShard entry.

      • configure

        public boolean configure​(MultiTreeMap config,
                         net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger loaderLog,
                         ClassFactory classFactory)
        Description copied from interface: Loader
        Configures an instance of the loader based on deployment data.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface Loader<Agent>
        Parameters:
        config - - the deployment data.
        loaderLog - - a Logger instance to use for logging messages, during the loader's activity.
        classFactory - - a ClassFactory instance to use to load classes.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration process was successful and the Loader instance is ready to load entities; false if this instance cannot be expected to work normally.

      • preload

        public boolean preload​(MultiTreeMap configuration)
        Description copied from interface: Loader
        Performs checks and completes the configuration.

        This method may be implemented by implementing classes in order to

        • Check that an Entity of type T and with the given configuration can indeed be loaded; it this method returns true, then calling Loader.load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>) with the same configuration is expected to complete successfully.
        • Add new elements to the given configuration so as to improve the subsequent performance of a call to Loader.load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>) with the same configuration.
        Depending on each specific Loader implementation, the call to Loader.preload(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>) may be optional or mandatory, but it is recommended that Loader.load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>) checks if the configuration has been pre-loaded and, if not, to call Loader.preload(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>).
        Specified by:
        preload in interface Loader<Agent>
        Parameters:
        configuration - - the configuration of the entity that one intends to load. This COnfiguration may be modified (added to) in this method.
        Returns:
        true if Loader.load(net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<? extends net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity<?>>>, java.util.List<net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap>)ing the entity is expected to complete successfully; false if the entity cannot load with the given configuration.

      • preload

        public boolean preload​(MultiTreeMap agentConfiguration,
                       java.util.List<Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>>> context)
        The method checks potential problems that could appear in the creation of an agent, as specified by the information in the argument. Potential problems relate, for example, to inexistent classes for shards.

        The method creates the necessary AgentShard instances and pre-loads them.

        If the agent will surely not be able to load, false will be returned. For any non-fatal issues, the method should return true and output warnings in the log.

        Specified by:
        preload in interface Loader<Agent>
        Parameters:
        agentConfiguration - - the MultiTreeMap, as loaded from the deployment file.
        context - - the entities that form the context of the entity to be loaded. The argument may be null or empty.
        Returns:
        true if no fatal issues were found; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Loader.preload(MultiTreeMap)

      • load

        public Agent load​(MultiTreeMap agentConfiguration)
        This method calls load(MultiTreeMap, List, List).
        Specified by:
        load in interface Loader<Agent>
        Parameters:
        agentConfiguration - - the configuration data for the entity.
        Returns:
        the entity, if loading has been successful.

      • load

        public Agent load​(MultiTreeMap agentConfiguration,
                  java.util.List<Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>>> context,
                  java.util.List<MultiTreeMap> subordinateEntities)
        The method loads all the information necessary for the creation of an agent and returns an Agent instance used to manage the life-cycle of the loaded agent.
        Specified by:
        load in interface Loader<Agent>
        Parameters:
        agentConfiguration - - the MultiTreeMap, as loaded at deployment.
        context - - the entities that form the context of the loaded entity. The argument may be null or empty.
        subordinateEntities - - a flat list of entities that should be loaded inside the loaded entity. This may be null.
        Returns:
        an Agent instance for the loaded agent.
